website_summaries.verdict: A compact pocket knife that never requires sharpening because you can replace the blade.
pros: Compact knife that's only 2.4 inches long when folded up
Accepts a standard utility blade, so there's no need to resharpen the blade
cons: Some users have said that it's difficult to deploy the knife blade

customer_reviews.title: Get a straight easy open close one or send it back.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two, one easy to open and close the other is a thumbnail breaker to close. Flip a coin you might get a good one. If you get a good one the clip is not a pocket or belt clip, its a money clip. If you don't use money clips just crank open the clip with your thumb and it will come off. Then its a real small nice sized small package razor knife that fits flat and easy in your pants pocket.
customer_reviews.author: James - Oneof6

customer_reviews.title: Almost impossible to close.
customer_reviews.text: Immediately hate it and will be returning. The deal breaker is the locking feature is nearly impossible to disengage. I have other folding knives with the same locking function and they are able to be opened and closed with one hand, this one requires two and A LOT of effort. You basically have to shove your thumb nail in between the metal frame and push extremely hard while trying to twist in the opposite direction with your other hand hopefully providing enough force to unlock it. I wouldn't mind it taking two hands to close if it were much easier, but this is absurd. I'd recommend buying something else because this product sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Evan H.

customer_reviews.title: Tiny, but does not hold up.
customer_reviews.text: For starters I did not realize this required a tool to replace the blade. My fault for overlooking. The problem is that the screw stripped very easily. I've done approximately 3 blade changes and it's completely stripped. The blade itself has too much exposed Edge and my forefinger naturally wants to fall on the edge of the blade when handling. Also, after three months the entire folding mechanism feels like it's getting loose. Overall very dissatisfied. On the plus side it is very small and minimalistic and you can easily forget that it's in your pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Bright Light

customer_reviews.title: What A Fun Knife
customer_reviews.text: As a guy who bought a SuperKnife when folding utility knives didn't exist, let me say: If you want to open stuff and don't want to worry about screwing up your blades, get this knife. I love knives. The problem is, I really don't want to screw up my nice knives by actually having them cut through cardboard. This is where the EAB comes in. It's small -- fits in a jean coin pocket. It uses replaceable utility blades, so you don't feel bad when it gets nicked. There's a lot of talk about "everyday carry" -- but this is a knife I really do carry every day, because it does the job, and if the blade snaps, oh, well!
customer_reviews.author: R. L. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Works well & I use it for EDC, boxes & such. I also have another blade I carry daily, but in everyday life, if one pulls out a dagger, people absolutely freak. This works in a standard social environment. It appears to be zinc coated copper & it's no lightweight, but is secure when opened. I don't really care for the blade changing screw & Gerber should address it. It would be a simple matter to put a rounded stud in it's place instead. I use Stanley extra heavy duty blades with it - they're thick & hold up well
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Over a decade of daily use and counting
customer_reviews.text: I’ve carried this Gerber utility knife in my pocket for over a decade now. I feel naked without it. Ha! Just ordered a backup because I'm worried I'll lose this one and they will stop selling them. Love the thing! I polished it and broke the clip off so it slips in and out of my pocket with ease. Use the gold (“titanium”) kobalt blades sometimes for a little razzle dazzle. Thing has come in handy a thousand times. You can flip the blade for a fresh edge between new ones. I was sick of sharpening pocket knife blades and the razor in my wallet bit wasn’t... (puts on sunglasses) cutting it..
customer_reviews.author: LoganExplosion

customer_reviews.title: So, so small and thin, which is a pro and con!
customer_reviews.text: The size of this cannot be beaten. It folds tight, no risk of opening. Ergonomics are another thing, though. It has a very boxy shape that makes it hard to hold in addition to how small it is. Despite this, it's my EDC because it is so small and thin. I carry this and a Micra instead of a Benchmade/surge combo when I'm at the office. Far lighter and nearly as versatile. Blade affixes with a screw, which could be a negative if you don't carry a dime or multitool on you. At home I still prefer my fastback, but for a pocket carry nothing beats a sharp blade you don't care about dulling in a super small form factor.
customer_reviews.author: Evan WalkerTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but has a couple quirks.
customer_reviews.text: Handy little box cutter to carry around everyday. My only two complaints are the ergonomics are a little off and it doesn't stay shut all the time. It's small and a little odd to grip but it's not a deal breaker. If you're using this everyday for work or something I would opt for a bigger option like a Husky. The other thing is it's pretty loose when closed. I haven't carried it a whole lot yet but it has slightly opened when clipped in my pocket. This could be a big issue if it opened any further and you put your hand in there with the blade hanging out..
customer_reviews.author: Boston

customer_reviews.title: A ridiculous tiny screw to change blade
customer_reviews.text: Horrible dumb design. Razors are meant to be sharp. Get dull. Flip around. Then replaced. Only with this design the only way to flip the blade or replace it is to unscrew it’s tiny odd sized screw. You need a tool to unscrew it, and losing it can be very simple. Why would you want to be out somewhere needed a sharp blade and the only way you can flip it is with a tool. And then easily drop the screw and you’re left with garbage. There is no reason they couldn’t have designed this with some sort of tab or something like every other razor knife has.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Schneider

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: SUPER disappointed. It is nearly impossible to close the blade. After I opened it, it took me five plus minutes of fiddling with the liner lock to get the blade to close. I’m hoping that I got a fluke, but the one I got is HORRIBLE! The blade even had a moist residue on it and some dirt. I’m returning it for a refund. I purchased an EAB lite from Home Depot, and did not have this problem. Super disappointed
customer_reviews.author: tayboleg

customer_reviews.title: well made as expected from Gerber
customer_reviews.text: EAB lost the war on ease of change. must use an additional tool, screw driver. Small is easy to lose and have had difficulty in obtaining new screws from factory. I ordered a number of these for friends and the lost the screws in the field like I did because you need a tool and the screw is gone in an instant.My experience was that I was told that I could get a replacement thru ACE hardware. wrong special screw from gerber. I gues that their employee thought that I had ordered enough and didn't have a need' Sorry you lose Gerber and it make me wonder about your service in general. I have been put off from buying Gerber
customer_reviews.author: Lee larson

customer_reviews.title: A beautiful knife - we've come a long way from ugly box-cutters
customer_reviews.text: This knife feels heavy and stable in your hand. I would not recommend it for hours-and-hours of use - your hand would feel the wear. Opens cleanly and stay open; and locks closed to stay closed. It comes with a thick sharp blade and after two years of intermittent use, the blade is a bit dull. I'll reverse the blade. Nice to have. And my wife doesn't know how to open it -- a plus. Not a self-defense knife -- too small. Not a survival knife -- too heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Oz DiGennaro

customer_reviews.title: Nifty little device
customer_reviews.text: It would get five stars, but it can be a beast to close. It takes force in a tiny area that practically leaves gouges in my thumb to get it to close, otherwise I love it and I hope it will loosen up a bit with regular use. Pros ________________________ Small - Folds up tiny Compact - See Above Sturdy - Seems like very strong metal body and secure blade holder Easy Maintenance - Takes utility blades I already keep around instead of constant sharpening Good clip - easily clips on a belt or pocket Cons ________________________________________________________ Practically breaks the skip pressing the release to close it.
customer_reviews.author: HiGravity

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these. They are inexpensive and reliable. I lose one every couple months. No big deal for $10.00. I buy 4 at a time and keep them as back up. My knife gets used for things other than cutting boxes like a Screwdriver, Hammer, Prybar, LOL.. Just replace the broken blade and move on. There are many blade choices available; Titanium, Serrated, and the carpet hook is great for cleaning deer. I can't find a stainless steel blade which would be really nice. My only complaint is sometimes the clip will come apart and you can't use it as a pocket clip anymore. Still for less than $10 !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great little tool
customer_reviews.text: I discovered this knife by clicking through an affiliate link somewhere and am glad I did. I read the reviews here (thanks y'all) and pulled the trigger. I've had it for 2 years and other than replacing the blade a few times it still works as if it were new. I carry it almost everyday. I still carry my Benchmades, but those can be little too much knife for what I need most days, plus I don't have to worry about losing them.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for daily carry, small without sacrificing function
customer_reviews.text: Excellent utility knife in a very small form factor. Fits perfectly into the coin pocket of your pants or it can be used as a money clip. It’s an excellent choice for a daily carry blade. So small you’ll hardly notice it, but the size does not come at the cost of function. In the stowed position the blade is fully covered and unlike other folding holders that use this size blade when closed the blade can not get pushed into the knife body and get dulled. The included utility blade is thicker than a standard Stanley refill, while thinner blades will fit you’ll want to use thicker “heavy-duty” replacement blades for best fit.
customer_reviews.author: R Rahmani

customer_reviews.title: Bad redesign.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought about five of these knives. they were great so when I lost one I just bought another. but the recently redesigned this knife with a smaller, stiffer lock spring and I am unable to close it by hand. I am returning as defective and am staying away from this knife and the company from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Nice design & finish, terrible assembly
customer_reviews.text: I love the design, finish, and functionality of this knife. Unfortunately it is let down by the terrible assembly/ quality assurance of the Chinese assembly process - the belt clip is crooked and not in alignment with the rest of the knife. It functions fine so if you don't care about aesthetics this knife is just fine. I returned my first knife and asked for a replacement - the replacement had the same defect. Maybe you will get lucky and your knife will be from a different production run. In the meantime I will try my luck with ordering one directly from Gerber.
customer_reviews.author: R. Grayson

customer_reviews.title: Good, despite being a gerber
customer_reviews.text: This is a surprisingly handy, well-functioning tool. As a rule, I generally tell people not to buy Gerber knives. The products they have sold in the past decade haven't been worth the bad materials they've made them out of. Their slew of cheap junk mixed with rip-offs of legitimate companies have put them on the "Do Not Buy" list. However, the EAB is a pleasant surprise. It is small and effective. No frills and the fit and finish aren't phenomenal, but it is still a good deal for the money. It is my go-to utility knife for light tasks because of it's convenient size and sturdy build.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Great pocket knife.
customer_reviews.text: This is small enough to fit in the "change" pocket of your blue jeans. Works great and is very well made. I agree with the other review that says this one is better than the Lite. Yep, feels better in your hand. If I had any complaint it would be that the pocket clip cannot be removed and it would feel even better in your hand without it. Certainly not a big deal. I keep this in my change pocket as an emergency back up to whatever other knife I have with me.
customer_reviews.author: James S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect edc, period.
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through dozens of different styles and brands of pocket knives. This Gerber is by far the most compact, easy to carry, useful and practice edc knife I have found. I bought four and gave them to family. If you buy any other knife you worry about dulling the blade...until it is dull then, you worry about sharpening it. Gerber has built a platform that supports a common utility blade. If that blade goes dull, flip it. If it goes dull again, replace it. Simple and utterly useful. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Brainspigot

customer_reviews.title: Great EDC Item
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this utility blade to EDC it and it is actually pretty nice. I was slightly worried about the build quality but I was pleasantly surprised when I started testing it out. The liner lock works good and it never feels like it will close up on you. The pocket/money clip is nice, but due to its size, it causes a hot spot in your hand when using the knife. Not the end of the world but definitely annoying. I never feel like my finger will slip onto the blade, which is nice. I would definitely buy it again if I lose this one. Great little EDC item.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Sleek, strong, highly portable box cutter
customer_reviews.text: If you’re tired of carrying around an underpowered pocket knife, but don’t want to carry a bulky box cutter, this cutter is for you! It’s easy to carry, looks great, and the standard replaceable blades means it’s always razor sharp. The build quality is excellent - strong and solid movement. I’ve got one in my backpack, my car, and my desk. Now it’s easy and convenient to open all my amazon purchases - the box, and those indestructible plastic wraps. It doesn’t have an ergonomic handle, so for big or heavy-duty jobs. I do have some regular box cutters. Still this cutter works amazingly well and handles 99% of my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Alex B

customer_reviews.title: Durable and light.
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed for work. I didn't want to carry a knife around in the office anymore and felt a box cutter would be more workplace appropriate as I have a business need for one. The knife is very light and durable. The lock is extremely sturdy and almost a little too difficult to close, but better safe than sorry. So far it seems very well-made. It's slightly smaller than I imagined when it's closed which is actually a plus. I can see some people using it as a money clip as described.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Beware, falls off pockets
customer_reviews.text: The clip loses tightness rapidly and within a few months had gone from an extremely tight grip on my jeans pocket to a soft grip, and then it fell off somewhere in public and disappeared. Pity, because I liked it. Not good for EDC. Amazon replaced the one that disappeared, and now I keep it in a special little pocket my wife has sewn onto my trousers. It's safe at last.
customer_reviews.author: sugarlump

customer_reviews.title: Good and bad
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these as stocking presents for my grandsons. One is so difficult to open that I’m sure he isn’t using it. The other was easier, but not as good as one I bought for myself last year. Unfortunately I don’t know what it is. It has a release button to allow the blade to close. The Gerber requires an awkward stiff release that actually was difficult to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: Rik Pierce

customer_reviews.title: great EDC
customer_reviews.text: This knife's lightweight and compact design is great for edc. I've been using the Lennox Gold blades in mine and it still has a razor sharp edge after a month of use. It takes some getting used to but you can open it one-handed. I don't have the issues with the clip that some other reviewers have reported. As long as you're not trying to clip it to anything thicker than your jean pocket or a couple of bills you shouldn't have any problems with it. I wouldn't recommend this as a replacement to a full sized utility blade for heavy usage.
customer_reviews.author: Arepo

customer_reviews.title: This is great. It's durable and holds the blade nice and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is great. It's durable and holds the blade nice and tight. I've bought similar products before and blade ends up getting loss after a few uses. I've waited a while to do my review just to see how it would really hold up. This gets used on a farm for cutting all kinds of things like rope, cord, canvas, tarp, cloth, etc. Basically if it can stand up to farm use for months it's good! Overall, I'm pretty happy with Gerber. It is more like a slightly glorified box knife then a pocket knife though, I guess it's kind of like a cross between the two, but that's not a bad thing at all.
customer_reviews.author: Alissa

customer_reviews.title: What is up with the price.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this little razor blade holder (knife). I own several but its currently listed at $21/ea which is more than double what I paid a little over a year ago. I hopped online to grab several more but its certainly not worth the 21.
customer_reviews.author: David McFadden

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive knife
customer_reviews.text: This knife is my favorite! I purchased it as a replacement for my old box cutter where the blade was coming loose all the time. I like that the blade is kept in place by the screw, so it is very sturdy. Yes, you have to remove the screw to change the blade but it's a fair compromise to keep the blade secure. I'm a woman with small hands, and this knife is easy to handle for me. I use it multiple times every day. I like it so much I bought 3 more to give as Christmas gifts!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small but mighty (and convenient!)
customer_reviews.text: One of these has lived in my pocket for years now. I love how easy it is to keep a sharp blade at all times. The tiny size makes this an awesome pocket knife for small framed folks, and it has held up to a lot of abuse - I’m pretty hard in my stuff and I am still on my first one of these, even after 4 years of constant use. Makes a great gift, btw!
customer_reviews.author: Shanna A

customer_reviews.title: Best folding utility knife period
customer_reviews.text: Originally had a husky replaceable blade, folding knife similar in design to this one. But i had a problem where the holder for the blade kept popping open and dropping the blade, since it was held with a button latch spring system, which came apart WAY TOO EASILY, which ended up cutting my hand a couple of times. This knife I have piece of mind, with the screw holding system, pretty confident the blade would never fall out, and it looks nicer and has a better locking system.
customer_reviews.author: Jaded Regrets

customer_reviews.title: A Rare 5 Star Product
customer_reviews.text: It’s easy for a 5 star rating to get lost on Amazon these days. And of my hundreds of reviews, I don’t give them out lightly. So what makes a cheap box cutter worthy? When you’re pleasantly surprised that what you received is even better than what the picture depicts. Nicely machined. Pleasant to hold. The perfect gift for someone who doesn’t need another knife.
customer_reviews.author: ©ooper

customer_reviews.title: Decent and Convenient
customer_reviews.text: Very functional and convenient. The most prevalent flaw to me was the difficult in deployment of the blade. It's not easy to get a good purchase on the blade carrier to open it but it nicely sized and convenient. Would probably function best as a money clip but it rides well clipped to the pocket. Swapping blades isn't too difficult but it does require a screwdriver to do it. It would pair well with a Victorinox or a multi tool to serve as a utility blade. (Obviously) Not intimidating so great for sheeple dense areas of carry :p
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Great edc knife for daily abuse.
customer_reviews.text: If your looking for an edc knife that can be used and abused without the worry of damaging a $100 knife this is a great option. Paired with some stainless steel razor blades it's perfect for people that actually use a knife to do more than open boxes. I would like to see a more prominent thumb stud or a cutout similar to spyderco for a one handed open. Buy 2 and keep one handy, for the price they can be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Zac

customer_reviews.title: Family liked them as EDC
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for Christmas gifts and one for myself. I like the EAB for the fact that it is compact and saves my good knives for tasks other than dulling their blades opening packages. My family liked them too as EDC. The blades are easy to change and knife is well made. Amazon had these on sale for just over $7 which is a great buy on these knives.
customer_reviews.author: Swampthang

customer_reviews.title: The only pocket knife you'll ever really need
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these from Wally World years ago and use it everyday. I've lost & bought multiples of these and still use them daily at work. No need to worry about sharpening, just use & throw away. Also you wont even notice you're carrying it due to its thinner frame and weight.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew T

customer_reviews.title: Nice little knife, with some problems
customer_reviews.text: I love the size and weight of this, you can clip it anywhere and hardly notice it. However, the lock sticks making it difficult to close one handed. Also as you can see in the picture, it came in with a manufacturing defect of some kind with a crack in the metal. I don't think it's going to affect performance too much, but worth noting. All that said, I'd buy it again. It's very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Devin Leonard

customer_reviews.title: LOVE. but after months of use, the clip falls off
customer_reviews.text: i adore this little knife. carry it with me everywhere and it’s incredibly useful. i must’ve dropped it too many times though because the clip falls off regularly now. got the eab light as a replacement but i definitely prefer this one - mainly because it’s a little smaller and can be open one handed, which is a feature i miss the most about the eab light.
customer_reviews.author: Kait Reay

customer_reviews.title: Small Well Made Knife
customer_reviews.text: I love almost everything about this knife. It is very very well made. When I take it out of my pocket I have to flip it over or around from what most of my other knives open. I'll get used to it. Have to use a screwdriver to change blade, I knew that when I ordered it so it's not a surprise it's just worth mentioning again.
customer_reviews.author: TD2

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I love this knife. It is a slim, light, polished, and functional piece of art. Folds so small and clips to my pocket so much more nicely than a common big clunky folding utility knife, and it makes it easy to reach into my pocket to grab my forklift keys while it's there. Surprisingly good price for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Mac

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality knife. From the reviews on here people complain about the screw that it isn’t that easy to change but the advantage to that is once you tighten it the blade has NO play at all not like most quick change knives. This knife will last for years and you don’t even know it’s in your pocket
customer_reviews.author: Mr Met

customer_reviews.title: Does not accept all replacement blades
customer_reviews.text: There doesn't seem to be a standard in blade shape that this complies with, the notches in the blades I've tried don't work with this knife and therefore limits my use of it as I don't care to have a partially open razor blade kicking around in my pocket...
customer_reviews.author: NorthernIndyRyan

customer_reviews.title: kind of suck
customer_reviews.text: Pros: can use disposable razor blades you find at a home depot for cheap price is ok foldable razor is very convenient pocket clip / money clip Cons: has lock stick which may be hard to close blade edge contacts the inside of the handle when closed which in time will dull the blade really fast uses a screw to remove and replace blades edges around the handles are sharp and not rounded off
customer_reviews.author: Davetheboy

customer_reviews.title: Close, but no cigar
customer_reviews.text: Nice, but it could have benefited from a thumb indent for an easy blade draw. As it is, it requires two hands to open, which limits its usefulness. I can whip out my kershaw leek WAY faster (obviously) and its just about as sharp. For how cumbersome it is to open and switch the blades, you may as well just use a full sized razor knife. Overall, I wouldn't buy this again. It sure does look nice though!
customer_reviews.author: ROb

customer_reviews.title: Great knife but clip is the downfall
customer_reviews.text: I love the knife but if the clip gets caught on something it is just pressed in and will fall out and never hold right again. I had a small tack weld done after this happened again and it is good now. If only the factory could do something about this, to begin with.
customer_reviews.author: Doverton1986

customer_reviews.title: Get the Lite.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't open quite as easily as the Lite (which is actually a bit heavier than this one) and overall simply doesn't feel right in the hand. Think of it more as a compact box cutter than a proper knife. Sure, the EAB Lite is the same in many respects, but has a better design. Probably the only real advantage this version has over the Lite is that it plays the part of money clip better, since you can't see through to the blade when it's folded up. It's less likely to give some easily startled person the wrong idea when you take it out.
customer_reviews.author: Roland MJ Ziemke

customer_reviews.title: I'm surprised how much I like this knife
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised how much I like this knife. I thought it would be too big to comfortably fit in my watch pocket but it fits perfectly. I got tired of sharpening my old knife and I thought this might work. Turns out it works great! Always have a sharp knife without the hassle of sharpening it. I popped the clip off because I just found it annoying. I thought this would be much bigger than my old pocket knife but it turns out it is almost the exact same size!
customer_reviews.author: d-dub

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing and I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.text: I got my first EAB in October of 2014 and I still use it on a daily basis at work. It’s smaller than the average pocket knife and uses standard box cutter blades. I have used that first it enough to to have gone through more than sixty of the Irwin Bi-metal blades (highly recommend BTW) that I prefer. I have since gotten a bunch of these to stash around and to give as gifts. I’ve never had one fail but I will warn you that it wouldn’t be hard to lose the screw that holds the blade in. I’ve yet to lose one but I have had close calls.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Wright

customer_reviews.title: Such a sharp looking and good cutting cutter.
customer_reviews.text: Those usual box cutters with the slide blade just don't cut it. This one does. Nicely designed. Such a nice feel in the hand. Blade is held in place by a little screw. The blades are the usual ones. I like this because there is more cutting surface than the traditional box cutter. Closing the blade is a bit awkward - but I don't mind this, it's not impossible. You could easily carry one in your pocket. I don't use the clip.
customer_reviews.author: Picklegirl

customer_reviews.title: Good design concept but it needs refinement
customer_reviews.text: I have had this knife less than two weeks. The clip has already failed and was lost. It is difficult to open or close this knife. The release needs to be a tad larger and they could use something to make it easier to open (perhaps a couple of groves in the surface). Standard blades are 0.60 mm thick. The "industrial" blade is 1.0 mm thick and replacements are unobtainable. Good design concept but it needs refinement. Weight with standard blade is 2.2 ounces.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis Balentine

customer_reviews.title: Solid dependable tool
customer_reviews.text: Convenient way to add an additional cutting tool to your EDC. Functional money clip and a handy way to carry a beater blade that is replaceable almost anywhere you go ( Stanley knife blade style replacement).
customer_reviews.author: john syrell

customer_reviews.title: Awesome inexpensive utility knife
customer_reviews.text: Great little utility knife for the price. It’s small, well designed, and inexpensive. I got so tired of carrying a little knife for opening boxes and then misplacing or losing it. My only complaint and it’s not big enough to effect my review is that it would be nice if they’d used a retainer for the blade that didn’t require any screwdriver to remove.
customer_reviews.author: RobertB

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS KNIFE
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my 4th one! Why? It's not because they break. It's because every time I someone sees it, they want one. So I give them mine and buy another. I carry this knife everywhere I go and use it almost daily. The included blade is thick and SHARP. And when it dulls, I flip it around to use the other side. When it's time for a new one, buy the good, thick ones. They last longer and don't break like the cheap blades.
customer_reviews.author: Todd L.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect EDC Razor Knife
customer_reviews.text: I usually always carry a pocket knife with me, but this little knife is pretty sweet, I carry it on my belt right next to my buckle and you almost forget its even there. Its come in handy quite a few times either when I forgot to carry my edc knife, or just when I needed to cut something that I don't want to use the razor sharp edge on my edc or other knives. Perfect for edc and just using around the house, fits pretty snug in my hands.
customer_reviews.author: Errin LTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Daly carry for over 10 years
customer_reviews.text: I have carried this knife daily for over 10 years I use it as a money clip it is very durable and works perfectly you can carry it anywhere and if you can't just toss the blade and get a new one they are easily available I will include a picture of the one I carry so you can see the wear
customer_reviews.author: big james

customer_reviews.title: A great every day carry knife
customer_reviews.text: For its price I don’t think it can be beat. I use it every day several times a day at work. It works great. I swapped out the taser blade it came with with some Lenox Gold razor blades, and the combo works amazingly well.
customer_reviews.author: McKay

customer_reviews.title: Lockup could be improved
customer_reviews.text: I knocked off one star on this review because the small liner lock on this Gerber E.A.B. is really not engaging as well as it should. It still locks up okay, but I know that this function could be better. Other than this one issue, I find this to be a most useful tool. 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: JimTop Contributor: Bass Guitars & Gear

customer_reviews.title: Solid quality build
customer_reviews.text: Ive had this knife for years and love it. Its moved from my wallet to my tool bag to my glovebox. Perfect size to stash somewhere for easy access for cutting boxes or whatever. The exposed blade legnth is longer than most utility knives as well. My one complaint is the blade set screw comes loose on occasion but its nothing a little blue loctite cant fix.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Prior

customer_reviews.title: how well it is made
customer_reviews.text: this is an update, I orded these two as extras but one was bad,very,very hard to unlock,the lock part was put in to low for your thumb to push It to unlock,other then that it is well made, so I am out $15 bucks plus I lost onebut that is my fault.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Lo Bosco

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great. I wish the clip arced out a little wider, so I could clip it to my jeans. Other than that, the blade is secure in the holder. The lock-open works. It feels fine in my hand and doesn't slip. The slot for the blade's retention screw is even wide enough to be opened with a dime if you need to reverse the blade, but don't have a flathead screwdriver with you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little knife.  My favorite!
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite pocket knife. Bought to replace the same one I lost. Quality is great, very sturdy. Use heavy duty blades for best results. Other reviews mention problems with the blade arm locking either too tight or too loose... I believe it's operator error. This little guy is well built with tight tolerance. Smooth opening and closing every time. Blade lock is very sturdy. Reccomend! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Sally Wolfsberger

customer_reviews.title: Great little knife!  Highly recommended for the value!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this knife! Does exactly what I expected and is nice and small. For someone with a larger hand, I am usually pretty comfortable with this knife. What I love the most is that I can use this knife for simple daily tasks and save my super sharp Kershaw knife for other needs/uses. This knife is easy to change out the blade, but will require a small flat edge to undo the set screw (a penny could most likely work in a pinch). The knife also does not have any extra storage space for additional blades. I've also used several different brands of blades with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: great little knife won't rust.
customer_reviews.text: very nice compact folding knife that also looks cool. it fell out of my pocket and lay in the grass for maybe 6 days. it rained a lot in that time and when i found it the disposable blade ( regular box cutter blades) had rusted pretty thoroughly, but the actual knife was practically spotless. it just needed a quick wash and a swapped out blade and it looked new.
customer_reviews.author: mattypoo

customer_reviews.title: Small and solid
customer_reviews.text: This folding box cutter is astonishing for the price. Solid when open with a firm liner lock, it is as rigid as a full-size box cutter. My only quibble with it is that the locking screw for the blade protrudes from the side, so it will scratch any susceptible surface it contacts. A flush-mount flathead screw would bring the rating up to five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Charles H

customer_reviews.title: Build quality is fantastic, it is solid feeling
customer_reviews.text: Very small but still large enough to use, which is the only reason I have not tossed it. Build quality is fantastic, it is solid feeling. The only issue is the screw holding the blade in is easily lost. and the tapped metal is very thin, meaning it can and will strip out if you try to tighten it at all. The blade is also hard tighten down. I have just gotten used to the slight jiggle in the blade. I have spend a good deal of time trying to find different screws that fit and hold the blade but don't get in the way.
customer_reviews.author: BryceJoseph

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great gift.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these razor knives as gifts and the recipients love them (they work in retail, so they are always opening boxes). The flat profile and light weight make them unobtrusive. They are well made and the blade is securely held in by a screw. The blade can be easily changed using a coin.
customer_reviews.author: Rich U

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice knife. It's small and well made
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice knife. It's small and well made. But I don't understand why Gerber sell it AND the EAB Lite version. They are essentially identical although the Lite is a tiny bit more bulky. See images. They both weigh 2-3/8 ounces on my digital scale. The Lite package says the blade is stainless. The non-Lite package says nothing about the blade. The Lite version is $1.83 less than the non-Lite.
customer_reviews.author: Bill S

customer_reviews.title: Best Little Box Cutter on the Market
customer_reviews.text: I love this little box cutter. I've purchased several of these, as well as one of the newer models, for myself and also a few as gifts. The quality and portability is great and it doubles as a money clip. Having one of these means you always a sharp pocket knife on hand and when the razor dulls you can easily flip the blade around and have a perfect edge again. When both sides are dull simply replace the razor. Changing the blade takes all of about a minute. If you are interested in having a reliable pocket knife that you never need to sharpen I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: DisKid

customer_reviews.title: Gerber Folding Matte Knife
customer_reviews.text: I got the sister to this last year and it works great. This one does not. It can be opened easily, but it can't be closed without jamming a flat blade screwdriver into the mechanism in order to actuate the release. Maybe I just got a faulty one. Back it goes, and I don't believe I'll order this particular model again.
customer_reviews.author: fourbyfive

customer_reviews.title: Great Every Day Carry
customer_reviews.text: Awesome design. I ripped through a bunch of boxes this weekend and the knife handled it perfectly. I took nutnfancy's recommendation and bought Irwin blades to use with this knife, so I cannot comment on the performance of the blade that is shipped with it. The knife is very comfortable, but I was concerned that it wouldn't have a good grip since it has a smooth finish with no jimping. However, the guard that is at the base of the blade gives you a nice grip that won't allow your fingers to slip and get cut. This thing goes with my everywhere and is so lightweight/comfortable that you won't realize you have it with you.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Smochko

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pocket razor knife.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great to keep clipped in your pocket. I open many boxes and cut cardboard daily and was tired of having to get my regular pocket knife sharpened all the time. Plus all the other folding razor knives are too big and bulky to carry in my pocket. This little knife is just what I needed. The only downsides one might see is the small size would inhibit safely cutting any heavy duty items; and the set screw has to come out in order to change the blade and could get lost easily if you are not careful. That being said, I still give it 5 stars because it is perfect for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Liam

customer_reviews.title: Great box cutter
customer_reviews.text: Nice sturdy knife. Very secretive and works like a charm for when I do my truck at the restaurant I work at. Only dislike is how I need to use a screwdriver to replace the blade, takes a few minutes and isn’t as easy as others can be.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Ok knife. Ok price
customer_reviews.text: Nice little travel knife. I can take the blade out, when traveling air. Buy a new blade when I arrive and be good to go. The only problem I had was fitment of the pocket clip. Assembly and Alignment were off. Otherwise would have been a 5-star review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I use this tool daily and love it
customer_reviews.text: I cut alot of boxes and various other banding materials but don't want to carry around a large box knife in my pocket all day and so this product is perfect. It is really small but this works just as well as my pocket knives and box knives. The best part is I don't have to sharpen my knives nearly as much because I am not dulling them on carboard all day, I just pop in another blade when dull and am off to the races. It's kind of a niche product but if you use box knives and want to save space it may be helpful for you.
customer_reviews.author: Ben D.

customer_reviews.title: 👍👍
customer_reviews.text: Amazing utility blade. The screw to secure the blade, imo, is a far better feature then other "quick releases" in the fact that it will not fail over time. Great craftsmanship. All around just perfect. It replaced my EDC knife. Thanks for an awesome tool Gerber! Despite the two sides of the topic...I believe Gerber makes killer tools/knifes ⭐ Job Title: Superload Operator
customer_reviews.author: Mark Parrish

customer_reviews.title: Really nice knife
customer_reviews.text: I love little pocket knives but the problem is they always eventually go dull and let's be serious, who ever actually takes the time to get them sharpened? This little gem is always sharp when you need it to be sharp. Changing the blade is simple and quick, plus it's slim and you'll forget it's in your pocket.
customer_reviews.author: IpMan

customer_reviews.title: A Work Of Art
customer_reviews.text: These things are a work of art. I bought 2 but 1 of them has a cosmetic defect hence the 4 stars. I also wish it had a quick blade change feature rather than unscrewing the screw un order to change the blade.
customer_reviews.author: jch85

customer_reviews.title: This is a great quality knife
customer_reviews.text: This is a great quality knife. It has held up. I like this because it is sleek and easy to carry instead of a big bulky box cutter. The only downfall is the clips do have a tendency to fall off, but easily fits in your pocket, and you don’t even notice. The blade is secured with a thumb screw which can easily be unscrewed with any U.S. coin, so you don’t need to have a screwdriver handy if you need to change the blade. Would recommend to friends, in fact I have recommended it to many of my coworkers. For the price you can’t really go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: freddog2325

customer_reviews.title: I've purchased multiple
customer_reviews.text: I've bought several of these over the past few years -- I hand them out whenever someone needs a knife I their pocket for everyday use. These work great but can the design causes them to be a bit of a pain to open one handed, hence 4 stars vs 5.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to your EDC I promise.
customer_reviews.text: Great EDC addition, compact, lightweight and well made all around. What I like about it its that you can change the blade when it becomes dull, and I have actually brought this knife thru TSA several times and not once have they stopped me lol (Not done it on purpose just forgot I had it with me), but if you do get stop you can always remove the blade and get a new one in your next location. No lie it looks like a money clip.
customer_reviews.author: Edgard

customer_reviews.title: Hard to close
customer_reviews.text: As one other reviewer indicated you may need to flip a coin to get the one that works. And keep this coin handy - if you happen to get the one that does not work - you may use this coin to push down the locking mechanism to close the knife. I purchased two and returning one of them where the locking mechanism just do not work. It is a pity - a flaw in otherwise very well made product
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Great minimal blade for work and everyday, also great present
customer_reviews.text: Great minimal utility blade, for the price nothing better, love how small and minimal it is since I hate carrying a lot of things in my pocket especially a pocket knife sometimes but this utility blade is perfect for everyday carry and work settings, great build quality every time someone sees this blade they are impressed how nice and small it is, since it is all metal design it is a little slippery and wish it would have some kind of texture or grip on the handle part but still and amazing priced blade great for gifts
customer_reviews.author: alex gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Delightfully minimal and unobtrusive. And inexpensive. Also, a dime is all that's needed for unscrewing the blade lock so no hunting for a screwdriver that fits for a blade change. The liner lock on mine is quite stiff and difficult to disengage one-handed. Might get easier over time.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Great little utility knife
customer_reviews.text: Great little utility knife. Fits perfect in the hand. I have large hands and works great. Wife even liked using. Folds up very small. Strong clip, durable. Liner lock. Lightweight. I got both lite model and heavy duty. I prefer heavy duty one. Feels better and has little finger groove by the blade, so you choke up on it.
customer_reviews.author: Gene K

customer_reviews.title: So handy
customer_reviews.text: In my building, you are required to break down delivery boxes before discarding them. This is almost impossible without a good utility knife. This is that knife. Also equally handy for opening said boxes, plastic packaging and so much else. It folds, unlike lesser utility knives.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great knife, very crude.
customer_reviews.text: it's my go to, i have the 'standard' variety of utility knives, but i always end up using this one. things to note: it's pretty hard to close for most people, and annoying for the rest. the blade securing mechanism is pretty bad. theres one tiny screw with a high tolerance mount that wiggles ALOT, whilst most blades have a lock or clip instead of a screw, it's generally not a very eloquent solution. that being said, still my favorite knife.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Best pocket knife I own
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite knife. The small size is perfect. And I can just replace the blade with a new one instead of dealing with a dull blade. The only problem with it is I keep losing it because it’s so small, but they aren’t expensive, so it’s not too big of a deal.
customer_reviews.author: Dallon

customer_reviews.title: Small a strong.
customer_reviews.text: It’s what you would expect from Gerber. Cheap but decent build quality. Nothing to fancy but works just as advertised. Worth the money no doubt. I wouldn’t carry it as an edc pocket knife but it makes a great addition to my edc bag as an always sharp knife.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Blackman

customer_reviews.title: Great Pocket Knife
customer_reviews.text: I use this as my pocket knife because I can replace the blade periodically to keep a sharp blade. It also folds down to a small size, and when I open the blade, the lock is solid so it does not close on my fingers. I bought a pack of Rapid Edge All-Purpose Rapid Edge Serrated Utility Knife Blades (50 count) for my replacement blades.
customer_reviews.author: Big Tone

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Utility Knife Ever
customer_reviews.text: I love this little Gerber! I have owned a handful of small box cutters but this is by far the best. Feels very solid and is the perfect size when folded up and when in use. The blade that it comes with is awesome, probably the best I have ever used but they are expensive to replace. The only downside is you have to remove the screw to flip and swap blades but ones with quick releases never feel as good and solid as this one and they are always larger. Overall an awesome little knife that I would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Ruzlawn

customer_reviews.title: Very nice knife for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, small knife/box cutter. Excellent fit of all parts; nicely polished, no burrs or rough spots. Opens easily, locks open securely. The only thing I don't like about this knife is the screw that holds the blade in. It is a flat tip screw, and a Phillips or perhaps a Torx would have been a much better choice for this application. I will almost certainly replace the screw in my knife. As a point of interest, this knife is branded "Gerber"; however the package it came in indicated it was actually made by "Fiskars."
customer_reviews.author: John Locke

customer_reviews.title: I was quite disappointed when I bought this because it would not lock ...
customer_reviews.text: I was quite disappointed when I bought this because it would not lock open. I had luckily purchased two one as a gift. When looking at the second one it did lock correctly. This is when I noticed there were some burrs and after cleaning those It has worked perfectly and been in my pocket everyday since. I have also removed the clip for a smaller profile. Though not easy (will need tools) it can be removed and replaced without damaging the knife.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: EDC Workhorse
customer_reviews.text: I use this box cutter every day and would recommend if it hasn't already been mentioned to get some grip tape and place it on the spine of the knife and the area Whare on a traditional knife would be a thumb ramp to then allow you to open this thing one handed.The product is a workhorse what more can I say and it's cheap just get one and stop reading reviews...you no who you are haha.
customer_reviews.author: Moki

customer_reviews.title: All-around good utility blade
customer_reviews.text: Gerber always makes sturdy good quality blades, so this blade was no surprised. I'm really pleased they created this knife: it just looks cool. It's very sleek, very thin, and feels nice and smooth. The ergonomics are nice because it has chipping at the bottom handle so you don't have to worry about your hand slipping off. It closes very nicely and I just love that it serves for the purpose of a money clip as well. If not, it can ride in your front pocket, or front chaptstick/coin pouch. I wouldn't mind ordering 10 of these; they're just so useful and cheap to have. Highly recommended. Great value!
customer_reviews.author: Silvia

customer_reviews.title: Bravo for an excellent knife!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The best pocket night for everything you want a knife for. Unlike most utility blade knives, this one holds the blade absolutely secure. The handle is easy to hold and use. The blade is not quick change without tools(you need a flat screwdriver) which is an advantage because the blade is completely secure and held tight within the blade mechanism. The price is very reasonable considering the quality of the knife. The only knife I carry every day for all purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Flinthills

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great alternative EDC weapon
customer_reviews.text: Compact enough to be carried very inconspicuously, yet scary enough to thwart a threat if necessary. Very nice build.
customer_reviews.author: 1inventorTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent knife. The quality is superb
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent knife. The quality is superb. I read some of these reviews and I have no idea what some people are talking about. It fits perfectly in your hand, opens and closes with precision and is very secure in both the open and closed position. I don't use it as a money clip because I travel all the time and you could never take this on a plane, It is quite small which I think is the best part. It fits easily in your pocket without being bulky. Perfect knife for me.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Marks

customer_reviews.title: Best utility blade handle I’ve owned
customer_reviews.text: Can’t beat the simple elegance it has while folded. Clip is super convenient to carry. Can be a bit uncomfortable if going a lot of difficult cutting
customer_reviews.author: Grand Duke

customer_reviews.title: Daily Use
customer_reviews.text: Always sharp and perfect for a lazy knife owner. I don't have to sharpen blades, just replace them. I use it mostly for cutting up boxes. Super slim and takes up almost no room in your pocket. Perfect size for the watch pocket in my jeans.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Huckeby

product_meta.title: Gerber EAB Pocket Knife [22-41830]
product_meta.description:
Like the men and women who carry our gear, Gerber is Unstoppable. Decades of innovation and dedication have put us here. Renowned as a master of knives and tools, Gerber's problem-solving, life-saving products are designed with the unique needs of specific activities in mind. Today that includes much more than a blade.

AMAZON.COM
The Gerber 22-41830 E.A.B. Pocket Knife with Exchange-a-Blade is a safe and lightweight alternative to the traditional box cutter, and because it accepts standard utility blades, you will always have a sharp knife handy.The pocket clip doubles as a money clip, and the liner lock construction keeps the blade safely open while in use. 

 

22-41830 E.A.B. Pocket Knife
with Exchange-a-Blade
At a Glance:  * Lightweight and slim flip blade stores comfortably in pocket
   
   
 * Accepts standard or contractor grade utility blade
   
   
 * Locks into open position
   
   
   
 * Pocket clip doubles as money clip



When one side of the blade gets dull, just turn the blade over. When both sides are dull, simply replace the blade. View larger. Durable Stainless Steel Construction for Long Life
Made from durable stainless steel, the Gerber E.A.B. Pocket Knife will stand up to daily use as a box cutter, pocket knife, or as the back-up knife you keep in your backpack, purse, or car.

Replaceable Blade Keeps Knife Sharp
With its handy exchange-a-blade feature, the Gerber E.A.B. Pocket Knife will always be sharp. Because it uses contractor grade or standard size utility blades, you can cheaply and conveniently change blades as often as you need. You won't have to worry about ruining the blade when you cut through tough surfaces--just replace it and keep working.

When one side of the blade gets dull, you can still use the other side by turning the blade over. When both sides are dull, simply unscrew the stabilizing screw and replace the blade.

Lightweight Knife Stores Comfortably in Pocket
At only 2.2 ounces and 2.4 inches in length when closed, the Gerber E.A.B. Pocket Knife stores easily and comfortably in your pants or shirt front pocket, keeping the knife nearby for frequent tasks. A convenient pocket clip doubles as a money clip and allows the knife to rest on the edge of the pocket, increasing accessibility.

Safety Features for Worry-Free Use
Liner lock construction locks the blade solidly in the open position, so you can apply pressure without worrying about the knife closing on its own. A finger guard over the blade keeps your fingers safe, and the shape and heft of the knife keep it from wobbling or slipping.

The Gerber E.A,B, also makes a great monogrammed gift, with its flat handle and slim profile.

About Gerber: A History of Innovation
Savvy. Moxie. Craftsmanship. Attention to detail. These are just a few of the company traits that have contributed to Gerber's emergence as a world leader in outdoor gear. Joseph Gerber started Portland, Oregon's Gerber Advertising back in 1910, and one Christmas, he hired a local knife-maker to craft 25 sets of kitchen cutlery as client gifts. The knives were so popular Mr. Gerber ultimately left his agency to launch Gerber Legendary Blades in 1939.

It makes sense, really. An idea man gets the idea of a lifetime and turns it into a major outdoor brand--one that commands respect among knife lovers and knife makers alike. And now that same high regard is spreading in new directions, in the form of many outstanding products such as tools, personal L.E.D. lighting, and more.

What's in the Box
Gerber 22-41830 E.A.B. Pocket Knife with Exchange-a-Blade.









FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Gerber exchange-a-blade pocket knife uses contractor grade or standard size utility blades that can be easily replaced as necessary. The stainless steel handle works well as both a pocket or a money clip and liner lock construction keeps the blade safely in the open position when in use. The blade screw is raised for easy opening.

See more
feature_bullets: Accepts standard or contractor grade utility blade
Pocket clip doubles as money clip
